journals.notes:
> - Linux: clarify libstdc version for GLIB compatibility ...
I don’t know what ideal GLIB version to compile with would be. I’ll try to compile linux binaries on Ubuntu 6.06 LTS. Hopefully, it is ancient enough.

We need to do at least a minimal testing run before we put the binaries on our website. Let’s set up "legacy" server on etlegacy.com:27961 and have a one hour match on Sunday evening, e.g. 17:00-18:00?

I did compile mods in the past on a Debian 5 VM with libstdc 5. But I think version 5 isn't an option anymore. From my experience Red Hat always runs after but maybe I'm wrong. strings /usr/lib/libstdc++.so.6 | grep GLIBCXX Current Debian Squeeze uses:

Version 2.70rc1 is tagged in git and linux binaries were uploaded to the Files section.
Linux upload has some issues ... I've removed it.

subject: Relase 2.70 rc1
description:
- finish installer scripts
-- add required files to the repo (misc path ?!)

- make sure we do release builds
- Linux: clarify libstdc version for GLIB compatibility ...
- fix icons for Win & Linux

Known issues:
- Linux: on very first start command map in Limbo may show undefined (orange) shaders
- Linux/Win?: omni-bot.cfg isn't stored in fs_homepath although 'SaveConfigChanges' is set to 1. (mabye related to relative path setting of omnibot_path ...)
